events.name: Pop Up Maker Space
events.description: Join David Liew,Kentaro Yasu and other Makers on 11th and 12th March at the Annex Hall Foyer, Science Centre Singapore. Free entry (but Science admission applies to non-members) Time : 11am to 4pm on both days.

events.name: Shaping the Future: Inside the Creative Mind
events.description: Wednesday 11th March 2015 2:30pm to 5:30pm ArtScience Museum, Level 4 FREE Shaping the Future: Inside the Creative Mind What is creativity and what role does it play in today’s increasingly homogenized world? Six leading practitioners of their respective crafts will gather to share their unique perspectives in an afternoon of illuminating insights and discussion. This is an event organized by the British Council and ArtScience Museum, and curated by Pomeroy Studio. The session will be hosted by Eco-architect, Professor Jason Pomeroy and speakers include: • Andrew Grant, Grant Associates • Jonathan Schütz, Award Winning TV director • Stephen Pimbley, Founder of SPARK Architects • Professor Anthony Bowne, Principal of Trinity Laban Conservatoire of Music & Dance • Tim Ross-Watson, Celebrity Chef Please go to http://peatix.com/event/75938 to register for this event.

events.name: Inviting Content Curators in IoT/IoE Space
events.description: Hi Everyone, We are inviting content curators, bloggers, and writers in IoT /IoE Space. They could be seasoned bloggers, technical writers, news writers, on whats happening in different industries and technologies in the region. We look forward meeting you and see if you would like to contribute to the community as a regular activities. What do you get to start with? • Active participation, networking, meeting and interviewing experts, VCs startup community. • Structured, and very focused team on IoE and IoT space.
events.location: Starbucks @ Plaza Singapura, 68 Orchard Road #01-53 Plaza Singapura Singapore 238839

events.name: PyData 2
events.description: PyData Meetup 2 Mark your calendar! !!!!!! DATE HAS CHANGED !!!!!! We will have two speakers for this Wednesday's meet-up! Kushal hails from Pune, India, and Shubham from Singapore (sort-of already lah! :-)) ---- Topic 1: Discovering distributed task queue in its simplest form using Retask Synopsis: The primary objective of this talk is to present Retask as a distributed Task/Job queues system. Retask uses Redis in the backend and keeps the data in JSON format. After the talk people will have the knowledge required to start using Retask in their own projects as distributed queue. The talk will demonstrate: Using queues can be easy! API (5 tiny methods, I promise). Asynchronous & synchronous communication between workers and producers. Real life use cases in Fedora Infrastructure and inside Red Hat. Speaker: Kushal Das is a core developer of CPython. He is a Fedora Ambassador and also director at Python Software Foundation. He is currently working as Fedora Cloud Engineer at Red Hat. Topic 2: Hands-on session: Using RNN to build classifiers and applications to reviews or sentiment analysis Synopsis: Soon... Speaker: Shubham Goyal Shubham is a nerd working at the Sensor Enhanced Social Media (SeSaMe) Center at NUS. He is happy to spend his time learning new things and sharing what he has learnt. Feel free to reach out to him at shubhamjigoyal@gmail.com if you want to say hi or waste time talking about most topics under the sun. He tries to maintain some sort of a CV over on LinkedIn (https://www.linkedin.com/in/shubham94) --- Venue --- Skyscanner 39 Robinson Road #09-01 Robinson Point Singapore 068911 Google Maps Street View: http://goo.gl/7ZrxIJ Directions from MRT: http://gothere.sg/maps#q:raffles%20place%20mrt%20to%20068911 http://gothere.sg/maps#q:tanjong%20pagar%20mrt%20to%20068911 An event of PyData SG: https://facebook.com/groups/pydatasg/
events.location: Skyscanner, 39 Robinson Road, #09-01 Robinson Point, Singapore 068911

events.name: Nico Nico Gakkai Beta in Science Centre Singapore
events.description: All presentation in English/ Entrance Free! NicoNicoGakkai Beta is a new style of academy that emphasizes user-generated research. It is an online and offline research academy that recognizes research on a diversity of merits, from cultural and artistic values to academic and industrial strengths. (http://blog.stepup.io/post/71963779785/nico-nico-gakkai-the-craziest-japanese-science) Rapid Fire Research 100 “Rapid Fire Research 100” was one of the two formats unique to this conference. In just 15 minutes, five world class researchers made 20 pitches each about their presentation. As a result, each speaker had to go though their 20~30 years worth of research in a very short time. To the audience, it was a comprehensive guide to each field as well as a motivating talk about how (initially) humble and error-prone research turns into world changing results. --In Japanese------------------------- ニコニコ学会βの人気企画、「研究100連発」を、 塚田 浩二 野嶋 琢也 寺田 努 稲見 昌彦 Jun Rekimoto 各先生方、および Maker Faire Singaporeの協力を得て、シンガポールサイエンスセンター・オーディトリウムにて、開館を特別に延長して行います！ 会場のサイエンスセンターはJulong East駅、AH2015が行われるマリーナ・ベイ・サンズから電車で40分ほどのところです。17:30-のAH2015終了後に会場に来ても間に合います！ もちろん入場無料です。ぜひご参加ください。 (プレゼンは英語ですが、動画も多いので誰が見てもわかると思います) Thanks Suranga Nanayakkara, Kiruthika Curic , Chan Sue Li and Maker Faire Singapore!
